result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrion M Certion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Endangering Safety by use of a Dangerous Weapon (Pointing), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered, this case predates the change in law.  

- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges,  collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of any applicable supervision.  To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

**Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).**
Concurrent with: with Count 3 but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. FORTHWITH.
Concurrent with: with Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. FORTHWITH.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of a Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerrion M Certion in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by Jacqueline C.

COUNTS 1 & 3 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  FORTHWITH

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  FORTHWITH

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered, this case predates the change in law.  

- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges,  collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of any applicable supervision.  To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

ENTRY MADE NO FILE.  Defendant Jerrion M Certion in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.   Case in court due to Justice Point violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on May 11, 2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.
Telephone call to attorney Avery Goodrich to schedule bail/bond hearing to address Justice Point Violation.  Case calendared for bail/bond hearing on April 27, 2016 at 1:30 in Branch 26.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrion M Certion in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  James C Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  

AS TO COUNT 1 & 3:
Defendant would like to proceed with a projected guilty plea.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense counsel requests new jury trial date.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.

Defendant taken into custody, he had mistaken his court times for today.    He thought he was to appear at 1:30 when his hearing was at 8:30.  A warrant was issued this morning.  The Court cancels warrant and the defendand is admonished.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
